intro: Hemiboea roseoalba, commonly known as the pink-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host tree through specialized roots called haustoria. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. Hemiboea roseoalba plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain insects and birds.
